intro: Ischnochloa falconeri, commonly known as Falconeri's grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. This plant is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine areas. Ischnochloa falconeri is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh mountain climates.
